scheme_name: National Scholarship For Post Graduate Studies
brief_description: A scheme started by Ministry of Education for the student Higher education.
detailed_description: The National Scholarship for Post-Graduate Studies (NSPG) scheme was established by the Ministry of Education, Government of India. The scheme was initially launched with the aim of providing financial assistance to meritorious students from economically weaker sections of society to pursue postgraduate studies in India.
benefits: Scholarships of Rs.15,000/- per month for 10 months in a year.
eligibility_criteria: Applicant must be pursuing first postgraduate degree. Applicant who have already completed a postgraduate degree are not eligible to apply. Applicant must be enrolled in first year of postgraduate program. Applicant must be under 30 years old. Applicant must be enrolled in full-time program. Applicant must be pursuing recognized postgraduate degree program.

steps: Open the official NSP website and click on New Registration under Applicant Corner. Read the Instruction /Guidelines, provide the under taking by click on Check box and click on Continue. Start the registration by Mobile OTP. Required document (Aadhaar Details and Bank Account Details)

Open the official NSP website and click on Fresh Application under Applicant Corner Login with application ID & password. Select the Scholarship. Fill out the applicant form. Upload the required documents. Submit.

documents_required: Attested copies of mark sheets and certificates from class IX onwards. Attested copy of the provisional or final admission letter to the PG course. Proof of identity (Aadhaar card, Voter ID card, Passport, PAN Card, Driving License). Bank details. Two recent passport size photographs.
